channel.title: JEditorPane and Applets
channel.description:
I know for a fact that JEditorPanes cannot work applets, mainly because they do not support the <applet>, <embed> and <object> tag but I know that there must be a way around this. Does anybody know how I could get it to work an <applet> tag? I have searched google and other places too but to no avail.
Thanks =D

item.title: JEditorPane and Applets
item.dc:creator: @imafatmess imafatmess
item.description:
@imafatmess wrote:

kk, thanks =D
I’ll look into it! I never knew sun had their own web browser but I suppose it’s obvious really since that (if I remember correctly) was how java was first created…[br][size=1]Posted at: July 16, 2006, 05:14:31 PM[/size][hr]So, where do you download the source of it?

Read full topic

item.title: JEditorPane and Applets
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

I’ve never looked into this personally, but I’d check out Sun’s HotJava browser - made entirely in java and it does apparantly support applets. After a quickly looking into the source, it seems that you may even bee able to incorporate its sunw.hotjava.applet package into a custom JEditorPane or something to support applets. Although the main browser panel seems to just be an awt Panel, you could possibly use it in a similar way with the JEditorPane

Read full topic

item.description:

I know for a fact that JEditorPanes cannot work applets, mainly because they do not support the , and tag but I know that there must be a way around this. Does anybody know how I could get it to work an tag? I have searched google and other places too but to no avail.

Thanks =D
